Bit scary when no one’s here. https://t.co/VSmmWfKYfr

I search books that can be used for reference by looking at the table of contents. However there’re few chances that the book gives me the answer. Surely the best way is to research on my own but that comes after I narrow the range down. First, I need to learn more expertise.

I kinda read thru few books (non fiction and science related) for reference to my next concept building but neither of them is not really interested enough to hit me. Now I’m going back to read my hobby book.

Found in my iPhone, the sketch by Yoji Shinkawa from early days of DS concept period. At that time there was no written script so I just verbally explained what the warriors space is like to him. We used to call it DEAD STRANDING as another name. https://t.co/W2dxo4T4pT
From Jan 9th, Saul Leiter comes back! https://t.co/5SlpgJMYOz
“Future and the Arts: AI, Robotics, Cities, Life - How Humanity Will Live Tomorrow” https://t.co/Ad4DZTcdxW

We’ll have Tokyo Olympic in the year of 2020, and also the extreme change in entertainment industry will come in next 10 years with the arrival of the streaming and AI. I’d like to create something related to such new media and totally brand new entertainment for the tomorrow. https://t.co/z0F3ClTzVt

Happy New Year. Hope you’ll have a wonderful year in 2020. 
After I made the 1st footstep with DEATH STRANDING last year, I would like to make another 1st and 2nd footstep this year. Hoping those trajectory will create the path. https://t.co/eRs7ntesij

I recommend Long Shot that I saw on the plane. It made me cry at the end. In 80’s, the love romance comedy was popular in Japan and those movies used to come to Japan soon after the US release but these days not so much make it to the theater unfortunately. Except this movie! https://t.co/lo6UPommWS

Read a lot of novels in 2019. I was hooked by Karin Slaughter in the beg of the year then since reading The Three-Body Problem made me wanna read Sakyo Komatsu (the way of storytelling was resemble!) I read his novels. In the end of 2019, I was hooked by Seiichiro Oyama’s novels.

I remember the welcome cookies I received 4 years ago right after I became independent. 

Thank you very much.

While AS series is peaked from the darkness this story soaks the darkness from outside. This darkness has no light/shadow. https://t.co/yUTHVvBuYD

Maybe I was too tired I slept over this morning. I wanted to go see Last Christmas 1st thing in the morning but realized today was Christmas Eve. Me as an old man going to the theater by myself on this day? I changed my plan to stay in my office working on my next concept. https://t.co/6dleNPEJmJ

As I was asked to write columns about movies/tv program on streaming I ought to watch those. “6 Underground” was one of the few that I saw a commercial of. As Cuaron and Scorsese gone to work with Netflix Original and then Michael Bay has joined too, I’m going to watch it. https://t.co/JUWl82YsXM

On 2015/12/16 I established Kojima Productions. Back then only I had was this logo and the temp room. No office, no staffs, no machine, no engine, but I already had a vision of "visiting plan" to deliver the play to the new world as being a LUDENS.Thanks to all ppl who supported. https://t.co/PtIghKf0GX
Bought ZERO POPULATION GROWTH on DVD. https://t.co/dRrxNB7U0f

Saw Jumanji Next Level. Like this film, inspire your courage in the game, get your trust back from friends, utilize your own abilities and save the world by cooperating each other. And such experience will connect to your real life. That’s exactly the power of game’s next level. https://t.co/MZwqKlJA4g

Watched French Anime, “J'ai perdu mon corps”. I had this special feeling inside me, it’s ephemeral, painful & beautiful. It’s something only able to express anime. The theme of HAND that connects to DS/MGS. It’s the film of phantom pain but also of the connection. Wanna buy OST. https://t.co/Tayyzco7NW

I wrote a quote for the film, "AN ELEPHANT SITTING STILL". As French media commented, to me this film reminds me of JOY DIVISION very much. Ho Bo,the promising filmmaker who ended his own life at a young age, evokes my memories of Ian Curtis. My best 3 this year, highly recommend https://t.co/rFHJhF2zAG
Good morning. https://t.co/Ac3YIqeM9D

1/2
First we shoot the live action by the handy camera based on my image and then fix the camera works, the direction, and the framing. Based on these we construct the details of shooting for the performance cap as well as the set (the rough CGI) preparation. (Continue) https://t.co/7p5CVue6q1

1/2
Here’s how we made the cave scene at the beginning. Making the rough initial pre-visualization for performance cap preps where we fix the movement, camera works, direction and the sound. The handy camera becomes the reference for the actual scene. (Continue) https://t.co/P73zEfHovP

1/2
This is the process of getting to know how much info can be included in the frame by testing with handy camera in order to visualize my image design. I write storyboard but skip the drawing and prioritize shooting to speed up and also we can share the ppl’s movement (continue https://t.co/d2VDSBgAVo

The design of the corpse bag in DS was inspired from the mummy package of Inca Empire. The mummy exposing the face in the photo on the right hand side, the outer cover has been taken by the thief. https://t.co/ye43nzbq1V

Mummies of the world exhibition covers all mummies of Inca, Egypt, Europe, Oceania, China and Japan(self-made mummy). You can see the element of motif used in DS. In fact the whale in Heartman’s room’s ceiling was captured the one from National Science Museum. https://t.co/I4voENRIBL

As to make the scariest horror game, I’ll watch the scary movies in order to awaken my horror soul. THE EYE is the Thai horror movie I rent when making PT but was too scary to finish watching. The package is scary so I rented the disc only. Will I be able to finish watching? https://t.co/BVwPruUAvt
